means: （业余性的）戏剧演出，舞台表演艺术
戏剧的( theatrical的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: I always was good at amateur theatricals.
His success in amateur theatricals led him on to think he could tread the boards for a living.
sentence.Network_cn: 他业余演戏很成功,他因此觉得自己可以以演戏为生.

sentence.Network_en: I'm to be in the Thanksgiving theatricals.
sentence.Network_cn: 我要参加感恩节的演出.

entry.def: Theatrical means relating to the theatre.

example.ex: These are the prizes given for the most outstanding British theatrical performances of the year.
example.tran: 这些奖项将要颁发给本年度英国最杰出的戏剧表演作品。

entry.tran: (行为)夸张的，做作的，戏剧性的
entry.def: Theatrical behaviour is exaggerated and unnatural, and intended to create an effect.

example.ex: In a theatrical gesture Glass clamped his hand over his eyes.
example.tran: 格拉斯做了一个夸张的手势，用一只手将双眼紧紧捂上了。

entry.tran: 盛大的;壮观的;有戏剧效果的
entry.def: Theatrical can be used to describe something that is grand and dramatic, as if it is part of a performance in a theatre.

example.ex: There was a theatrical air about the whole scene which had a great appeal for me...
example.tran: 整个场面很宏大，深深吸引住了我。

example.ex: The clothes were very showy, very theatrical.
example.tran: 那些衣服很艳丽很华美，像戏装一样。

entry.tran: (尤指业余的)戏剧表演，娱乐表演
entry.def: Theatricals are performances of plays and other entertainments, especially when they are done by actors who act as a hobby rather than a profession.

example.ex: I always was good at amateur theatricals.

auth_sentence.content: A landscape without theatricals except when it became an arena for summer storms.
auth_sentence.res_content: A landscape without theatricals except when it became an arena for summer storms.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A landscape without theatricals except when it became an arena for summer storms.

auth_sentence.content: Stravinsky and Benois based their libretto on the Punch-and-Judy theatricals given during Shrovetide in old St. Petersburg.
auth_sentence.res_content: Stravinsky and Benois based their libretto on the Punch-and-Judy theatricals given during Shrovetide in old St. Petersburg.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Stravinsky and Benois based their libretto on the Punch-and-Judy theatricals given during Shrovetide in old St. Petersburg.
